etymology.description: Depicts threads of silk arranged vertically, representing fine silk
etymology.interpretation: The character 糹 (mì, "fine silk") visually represents fine strands of silk with vertical lines suggesting the texture and thinness of silk threads.
etymology.simplification: The traditional form 糹 was simplified to 纟 by retaining only three vertical strokes, capturing the essence of silk threads.

examples.chinese: 这种糹制作的衣服格外精美(這種糹製作的衣服格外精美)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng mì zhìzuò de yīfú géwài jīngměi。
examples.english: Clothes made from this fine silk are exceptionally exquisite.

examples.chinese: 古代使用糹编织华服(古代使用糹編織華服)，现代依然欣赏糹质的魅力(現代依然欣賞糹質的魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài shǐyòng mì biānzhī huáfú, xiàndài yírán xīnshǎng mì zhì de mèilì。
examples.english: In ancient times, fine silk was used to weave splendid garments, and even today, its texture is admired.
